gw.api.financials

Class CheckCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.financials.CheckCreator

  • public abstract class CheckCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    A class with a builder-like interface to help create Check entities and all their sub-objects. Obtain a CheckCreator by calling the newCheckCreator() method on Claim or Exposure.

    See also: CheckPayeeInfo, MonthlyCheckRecurrenceCreator, and WeeklyCheckRecurrenceCreator.

    Author:
    jshen

      • getCheckSet

        public CheckSet getCheckSet()
        Returns the CheckSet instance, if any, associated with this CheckCreator. May be null, if no CheckSet instance was externally provided and createCheck() has not yet been called on the CheckCreator.

      • createCheck

        public Check createCheck()
                  throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException
        Creates the check defined by the current state of the CheckCreator. Use the methods that begin "with...()" to specify the data to use when creating the Check and subsidiary entities. After the Check is created by calling this method, the Check entity and its sub-objects may be modified. As always, you must thoroughly test the results when modifying entities in this way.

        After calling createCheck() and performing any modifications to the resulting Check, you must call prepareForCommit() to submit the check for approval and update Taccounts.

        This method override must call the super.createCheck() method.

        Also, copies the EFTData from the primary CheckPayee to the Check. Failing that, copies the EFTData from the most recently created or update EFTData record.

        Returns:
        new check, which is also stored inside the CheckCreator for the subsequent call to prepareForCommit()
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException

      • prepareForCommit

        public Check prepareForCommit()
                       throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException,
                              com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException,
                              com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException
        Prepares the previously created check for commit to the database. Call this method after calling createCheck(), and after performing any modifications to the check, such as adding additional Payments or TransactionLineItems. This methods submits the check for approval and updates Taccounts.

        After calling this method, the check may not be modified, except for extension fields.

        Returns:
        newCheck
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the check
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException - if there is a problem during workflow validation
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException

      • createAndPrepareForCommit

        public final Check createAndPrepareForCommit()
                                      throws com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException,
                                             com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException
        Calls createCheck() and then prepareForCommit(). Note: this method should not be customized. Instead, modify createCheck() or prepareForCommit(). It is not overrideable.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException
